thread.title: BREAKING Jack Grealish's family 'feared being held hostage' home robbery for £1million of jewellery
thread.title_full: BREAKING Jack Grealish's family 'feared being held hostage' home robbery for £1million of jewellery

author: staronline@reachplc.com (Tom Sunderland)
title: BREAKING Jack Grealish's family 'feared being held hostage' home robbery for £1million of jewellery
text: Manchester City ace Jack Grealish's family "feared they were being held hostage" in a home burglary that saw them robbed of more than £1million worth of goods. England winger Grealish was away on duty with the [Premier League](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/latest/premier-league) champions at [Everton](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/latest/everton-fc) when the burglary in understood to have taken place on Wednesday. A source close to the family told [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/25187642/jack-grealish-family-feared-held-hostage-gang-thugs/): “The family are really shaken. The gang took a lot of watches and jewellery." The same source went on to say the family first feared "they could be facing a hostage situation or worse." It's understood the invaders made off with seven figures worth of prized possessions but that nobody was harmed in the raid. It's understood girlfriend Sasha Attwood, Grealish's mother and father, his grandmother, two sisters and brother were all at the 24-acre property while the robbery took place. A Cheshire Police statement quoted by The Sun read: “At around 9.50pm on Wednesday December 27 police were called to reports of a burglary. The caller reported that a number of items had been stolen. "Officers supported by police dogs and National Police Air Service were deployed and searches were conducted in the local area but there was no trace of the suspects. More to follow.
